alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 3:23AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very light freezing drizzle or flurries will be possible overnight, with areas of light freezing rain and light sleet increasing in coverage this morning. Ice amounts around a tenth of inch will be possible along I-44 with higher amounts around a quarter inch possible across southeast Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas. The heavier wintry precipitation will shift east of northwest Arkansas by mid to late afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of east central, northeast and southeast Oklahoma and northwest and west central Arkansas. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
